channel.title: engineering management on the misfit manager
channel.description: Recent content in engineering management on the misfit manager

item.title: betting on myself
item.description: And that pesky little voice that used to constantly tell me I was a fraud, that I couldn’t code, that I couldn’t lead?

item.title: i’m lonely
item.description: Before you click away, don’t worry, it’s not contagious. In fact, you’re probably lonely too. But I am not talking about the greater cosmic loneliness problem that is occurring as we dive deeper into online connections. I’m professionally lonely. As a manager, I’m a contractually obligated secret keeper. People tell me things that are legally risky to share; as an extreme example, building a termination case. It would be seriously problematic if I still went around telling everyone every new piece of information I learned.

item.title: intro
item.description: Unlike many of my peers, I am blatantly unorganized, overly friendly at work, unconventionally frank, and someone who once crashed into a LinkedIn VP on one of those hoverboards that we later learned spontaneously catches on fire.
